edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Destination, Enemy, Goodie, Hero, Obstacle, Projectile

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    Actor is the base class upon which every game actor is built. Every actor has a physics representation (rectangle, circle, or convex polygon). Actors typically have an image associated with them, too, so that they have a visual appearance during gameplay. A game should rarely deal with Actor objects directly, instead using Hero, Goodie, Destination, Enemy, Obstacle, and Projectile objects.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(SpriteBatch sb,
                   float delta)
        Every time the world advances by a timestep, we call this code. It updates the Actor and draws it. User code should never call this.

        Returns:
        The string that the programmer provided

        Parameters:

      • setCameraOffset

        public void setCameraOffset(float x,
                            float y)
        Make the camera follow the actor, but without centering the actor on the screen
        Parameters:
        x - Amount of x distance between actor and center
        y - Amount of y distance between actor and center

      • setCollisionsEnabled

        public void setCollisionsEnabled(boolean state)
        Change whether this actor engages in physics collisions or not
        Parameters:
        state - either true or false. true indicates that the object will participate in physics collisions. false indicates that it will not.

      • setPhysics

        public void setPhysics(float density,
                       float elasticity,
                       float friction)
        Adjust the default physics settings (density, elasticity, friction) for this actor
        Parameters:
        density - New density of the actor
        elasticity - New elasticity of the actor
        friction - New friction of the actor

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float rotation)
        Call this on an actor to rotate it. Note that this works best on boxes.
        Parameters:
        rotation - amount to rotate the actor (in degrees)

      • getVisible

        public boolean getVisible()
        Indicate whether the actor is currently visible or not.
        Returns:
        true if the actor is visible, false if it is currently in a hidden state (i.e., because it has been collected, defeated, or removed)

      • remove

        public void remove(boolean quiet)
        Make an actor disappear
        Parameters:
        quiet - True if the disappear sound should not be played

      • addVelocity

        public void addVelocity(float x,
                        float y,
                        boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Add velocity to this actor
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension
        immuneToPhysics - Should never be true for heroes! This means that gravity won't affect the actor, and it can pass through other actors without colliding.

      • setAbsoluteVelocity

                                float y,
                                boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Set the absolute velocity of this actor
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension

        public void setDamping(float amount)
        Set a dampening factor to cause a moving body to slow down without colliding with anything
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of damping to apply

      • setAngularDamping

        public void setAngularDamping(float amount)
        Set a dampening factor to cause a spinning body to decrease its rate of spin
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of damping to apply

      • setTouchCallback

        public void setTouchCallback(int activationGoodies1,
                             int activationGoodies2,
                             int activationGoodies3,
                             int activationGoodies4,
                             boolean disappear,
                             LolCallback callback)
        Indicate that touching this object will cause some special code to run
        Parameters:
        activationGoodies1 - Number of type-1 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies2 - Number of type-2 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies3 - Number of type-3 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies4 - Number of type-4 goodies that must be collected before it works
        disappear - True if the actor should disappear when the callback runs
        callback - The callback to run when the actor is touched

      • setStopCallback

        public void setStopCallback(LolCallback callback)
        Indicate that when this actor stops, we should run custom code
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to run when the actor stops

        Returns:
        Velocity in Y dimension

      • setRoute

        public void setRoute(Route route,
                     float velocity,
                     boolean loop)
        Make this actor move according to a route. The actor can loop back to the beginning of the route.
        Parameters:
        route - The route to follow.
        velocity - speed at which to travel
        loop - Should this route loop continuously?

      • setRotationSpeed

        public void setRotationSpeed(float duration)
        Make the actor continuously rotate. This is usually only useful for fixed objects.
        Parameters:
        duration - Time it takes to complete one rotation

      • setCanDrag

        public void setCanDrag(boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Call this on an actor to make it draggable. Be careful when dragging things. If they are small, they will be hard to touch.
        Parameters:
        immuneToPhysics - Indicate whether the actor should pass through other objects or collide with them

      • setTouchSound

        public void setTouchSound(java.lang.String sound)
        Indicate that when the player touches this obstacle, we should play a sound
        Parameters:
        sound - The name of the sound file to play

      • setPokeToPlace

        public void setPokeToPlace(long deleteThresholdMillis)
        Call this on an actor to make it pokeable. Poke the actor, then poke the screen, and the actor will move to the location that was pressed. Poke the actor twice in rapid succession to delete it.
        Parameters:
        deleteThresholdMillis - If two touches happen within this many milliseconds, the actor will be deleted. Use 0 to disable this "delete by double-touch" feature.

      • setFlickable

        public void setFlickable(float dampFactor)
        Indicate that this actor can be flicked on the screen
        Parameters:
        dampFactor - A value that is multiplied by the vector for the flick, to affect speed

      • setPokePath

        public void setPokePath(float velocity,
                        boolean oncePerTouch)
        Configure an actor so that touching an arbitrary point on the screen makes the actor move toward that point. The behavior is similar to pokeToPlace, in that one touches the actor, then where she wants the actor to go. However, this involves moving with velocity, instead of teleporting
        Parameters:
        velocity - The constant velocity for poke movement
        oncePerTouch - After starting a path, does the player need to re-select (re-touch) the actor before giving it a new destinaion point?

      • setFingerChase

        public void setFingerChase(float velocity,
                           boolean oncePerTouch,
                           boolean stopOnUp)
        Configure an actor so that touching an arbitrary point on the screen makes the actor move toward that point. The behavior is similar to pokePath, except that as the finger moves, the actor keeps changing its destination accordingly.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The constant velocity for poke movement
        oncePerTouch - After starting a path, does the player need to re-select (re-touch) the actor before giving it a new destinaion point?
        stopOnUp - When the touch is released, should the actor stop moving, or continue in the same direction?

      • setDefaultAnimation

        public void setDefaultAnimation(Animation a)
        Save the animation sequence and start it right away
        Parameters:
        a - The animation to display

      • setDefaultReverseAnimation

        public void setDefaultReverseAnimation(Animation a)
        Save the animation sequence that we'll use when the actor is moving in the negative X direction
        Parameters:
        a - The animation to display

      • setDisappearAnimation

        public void setDisappearAnimation(Animation a,
                                  float offsetX,
                                  float offsetY,
                                  float width,
                                  float height)
        Save an animation sequence for showing when we get rid of a actor
        Parameters:
        a - The animation to display
        offsetX - We can offset the animation from the bottom left of the actor (useful if animation is larger than actor dimensions). This is the x offset.
        offsetY - The Y offset (see offsetX for more information)
        width - The width of the frames of this animation
        height - The height of the frames of this animation

      • setAppearDelay

        public void setAppearDelay(float delay)
        Indicate that something should not appear quite yet...
        Parameters:
        delay - How long to wait before displaying the thing

      • setDisappearDelay

        public void setDisappearDelay(float delay,
                              boolean quiet)
        Indicate that something should disappear after a little while
        Parameters:
        delay - How long to wait before hiding the thing
        quiet - true if the item should disappear quietly, false if it should play its disappear sound

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.lang.String imgName,
                     int index)
        Change the image being used to display the actor
        Parameters:
        imgName - The name of the new image file to use
        index - The index to use, in the case that the image was registered as animatable. When in doubt, use 0.

      • resize

        public void resize(float x,
                   float y,
                   float width,
                   float height)
        Change the size of an actor, and/or change its position
        Parameters:
        x - The new X coordinate of its bottom left corner
        y - The new Y coordinate of its bototm left corner
        width - The new width of the actor
        height - The new height of the actor

      • setShrinkOverTime

        public void setShrinkOverTime(float shrinkX,
                              float shrinkY,
                              boolean keepCentered)
        Indicate that this actor should shrink over time
        Parameters:
        shrinkX - The number of meters by which the X dimension should shrink each second
        shrinkY - The number of meters by which the Y dimension should shrink each second
        keepCentered - Should the actor's center point stay the same as it shrinks (true), or should its bottom left corner stay in the same position (false)

      • setHover

        public void setHover(int x,
                     int y)
        Indicate that this actor should hover at a specific location on the screen, rather than being placed at some point on the level itself. Note that the coordinates to this command are the center position of the hovering actor. Also, be careful about using hover with zoom... hover is relative to screen coordinates (pixels), not world coordinates, so it's going to look funny to use this with zoom
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate (in pixels) where the actor should appear
        y - the Y coordinate (in pixels) where the actor should appear

      • setGravityDefy

        public void setGravityDefy()
        Indicate that this actor should be immune to the force of gravity

      • setSticky

        public void setSticky(boolean top,
                      boolean right,
                      boolean bottom,
                      boolean left)
        Make this actor sticky, so that another actor will stick to it
        Parameters:
        top - Is the top sticky?
        right - Is the right side sticky?
        bottom - Is the bottom sticky?
        left - Is the left side sticky?

      • setDisappearSound

        public void setDisappearSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Set the sound to play when this actor disappears
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file

      • setTouchToThrow

        public void setTouchToThrow(Hero h,
                            float offsetX,
                            float offsetY,
                            float velocityX,
                            float velocityY)
        Indicate that touching this actor should make a hero throw a projectile
        Parameters:
        h - The hero who should throw a projectile when this is touched
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        velocityX - The X velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        velocityY - The Y velocity of the projectile when it is thrown

      • setOneSided

        public void setOneSided(int side)
        Indicate that this obstacle only registers collisions on one side.
        Parameters:
        side - The side that registers collisions. 0 is top, 1 is right, 2 is bottom, 3 is left, -1 means "none"

      • setPassThrough

        public void setPassThrough(int id)
        Indicate that this actor should not have collisions with any other actor that has the same ID
        Parameters:
        id - The number for this class of non-interacting actors

      • setCanFall

        public void setCanFall()
        By default, non-hero actors are not subject to gravity or forces until they are given a path, velocity, or other form of motion. This lets an actor be subject to forces... in practice, using this in a side-scroller means the actor will fall to the ground.

      • setChaseSpeed

        public void setChaseSpeed(float speed,
                          Actor target,
                          boolean chaseInX,
                          boolean chaseInY)
        Specify that this actor is supposed to chase another actor
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed with which it chases the other actor
        target - The actor to chase
        chaseInX - Should the actor change its x velocity?
        chaseInY - Should the actor change its y velocity?

      • setChaseFixedMagnitude

        public void setChaseFixedMagnitude(Actor target,
                                   float xMagnitude,
                                   float yMagnitude,
                                   boolean ignoreX,
                                   boolean ignoreY)
        Specify that this actor is supposed to chase another actor, but using fixed X and Y velocities
        Parameters:
        target - The actor to chase
        xMagnitude - The magnitude in the x direction, if ignoreX is false
        yMagnitude - The magnitude in the y direction, if ignoreY is false
        ignoreX - False if we should apply xMagnitude, true if we should keep the hero's existing X velocity
        ignoreY - False if we should apply yMagnitude, true if we should keep the hero's existing Y velocity

      • getChaseactor

        public Actor getChaseactor()
        Get the actor being chased by this actor
        Returns:
        The actor being chased

      • setRotationByDirection

        public void setRotationByDirection()
        Indicate that this actor's rotation should be determined by the direction in which it is traveling

      • setZIndex

        public void setZIndex(int zIndex)
        Set the z plane for this actor
        Parameters:
        zIndex - The z plane. Values range from -2 to 2. The default is 0.

      • setRevoluteJoint

        public void setRevoluteJoint(Actor anchor,
                             float anchorX,
                             float anchorY,
                             float localAnchorX,
                             float localAnchorY)
        Create a revolute joint between this actor and some other actor. Note that both actors need to have some mass (density > 0) or else this won't work.
        Parameters:
        anchor - The actor around which this actor will rotate
        anchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        anchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        localAnchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor
        localAnchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor

      • setRevoluteJointMotor

        public void setRevoluteJointMotor(float motorSpeed,
                                  float motorTorque)
        Attach a motor to make a joint turn
        Parameters:
        motorSpeed - Speed in radians per second
        motorTorque - torque of the motor... when in doubt, go with Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY

      • setRevoluteJointLimits

        public void setRevoluteJointLimits(float upper,
                                   float lower)
        Set upper and lower bounds on the rotation of the joint
        Parameters:
        upper - The upper bound in radians
        lower - The lower bound in radians

      • setWeldJoint

        public void setWeldJoint(Actor other,
                         float otherX,
                         float otherY,
                         float localX,
                         float localY,
                         float angle)
        Create a weld joint between this actor and some other actor, to force the actors to stick together.
        Parameters:
        other - The actor that will be fused to this actor
        otherX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the other actor
        otherY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the other actor
        localX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor
        localY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor
        angle - The angle between the actors

      • setDistanceJoint

        public void setDistanceJoint(Actor anchor,
                             float anchorX,
                             float anchorY,
                             float localAnchorX,
                             float localAnchorY)
        Create a distance joint between this actor and some other actor
        Parameters:
        anchor - The actor to which this actor is connected
        anchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        anchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        localAnchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor
        localAnchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the actor) where the joint fuses to this actor

      • setKinematic

        public void setKinematic()
        In some cases, we need to force an actor to have a kinematic body type
